column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Meerel Ja looks shaken.
Search for the mysterious spirit.
Follow the mysterious spirit.
Speak with the mysterious spirit.
Investigate the suspicious shrub.
Deliver the jade ring to Meerel Ja.
I'd be wary of entering the forests right now if I were you. There's something strange on the loose out there─I saw it with my own eyes.
It had an otherworldly look to it, more spirit-like than anything. But when it motioned for me to follow it deeper into the trees, that's when I knew it meant trouble.
I encountered it north of Golmajiik Grove and west of the Blue-eyes' Abode. I wouldn't suggest following it...but if curiosity gets the better of you, let me know what you discover.
I saw that spirit-like creature north of Golmajiik Grove and west of the Blue-eyes' Abode. If you discover anything, let me know.
This must be the mysterious spirit Meerel Ja spoke of. It seems to be searching for someone to follow it...
Follow the mysterious spirit?
Follow the mysterious spirit and try not to fall behind.
The mysterious spirit stops, seemingly at its destination. Perhaps it will speak with you now.
The spirit says nothing, its gaze fixed upon the bottom of the cenote. Something must be down there.
The spirit's gaze is fixed upon the bottom of the cenote. Perhaps it seeks something hidden down there.
From the suspicious shrub you pull a jade ring, smeared with mud and marked with age. Someone must have dropped it.
You no longer feel the mysterious spirit's presence. You should tell Meerel Ja what you discovered.
Y-You didn't really follow that spirit, did you!? ...Did you learn anything?
Why, this is the ring my grandfather lost!
He used to live in Moxutural Zooj, before the village was abandoned. To this day, he remains devoted to the old teachings, including those regarding blessed siblings.
He still makes customary offerings of traditional dance by the same cenote, too. Perhaps he inadvertently called that spirit forth?
Regardless, I'm sure he'll be happy to have his ring back. Thank you, stranger.
